text: Are you a bookworm like me? I like to read, and I love to be surrounded by books.
I enjoy fiction, and I've read some books more than once because I like the story so much.
Is there a novel that you read in English and would like to tell others about?
If so,
then I'd like to invite you to join a very special course on Simor called Oral Book Reports.
This is a speaking and listening course for upper level students.
That's high intermediate and advanced. Space is limited.
The course will run from November 12th to December 7th.
The dates of the live classes are November 14th,
November 28th, and December 5th.
All live classes will be recorded. Each class will be 60 minutes long.
I'll also ask students to complete four quizzes on related vocabulary and grammar.
The course fee is $75 US dollars.
This is a small group course. Each student will have the chance to prepare and give an oral book report.
And each student will receive my detailed feedback.
These won't be very formal book reports.
I want to guide you to share the kind of summary that is natural for conversation.
Students will share book recommendations with one another in a very relaxed atmosphere.
Students will receive my support as they prepare an oral book report
to be presented two different ways: in the live class and then as an audio or video recording.
Please understand that we will not read a book in this course.
The book reports are based on books, you've already read in English.
You'll also need a good internet connection as well as a webcam and a microphone.
If you'd like to gain some fun practice telling others about a good book that you read, then join me for this special course.
Registration opens on November 5th.
To sum up, enrolled students will get three live classes,
four quizzes, and my personal support as they prepare an oral book report
to be delivered two different ways: in a live class and as an audio or video recording.
Here's what others have said about my small group courses on Simor.
I hope to welcome you into my classroom on Simor very soon. I wish everyone happy studies!
